job.title: (100% Remote) Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <p>Our customer is a SaaS based AI product development startup. Their product automates and personalizes restaurant orders on high-volume voice channels using artificial intelligence (AI).</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Title</u>&nbsp;</strong>- <strong>Site Reliability Engineer </strong></p><p><strong><u>Location</u>&nbsp;</strong>- Austin, Texas, United States - Remote till covid</p><p><strong><u>Duration&nbsp;</u></strong>- Fulltime</p><p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong></p><p><strong>● </strong>Be part of on-call rotation to respond to urgent bugs or production outages</p><p>● Proactively identify and fix infrastructure bottlenecks</p><p>● Choosing tooling for and understanding of CI / CD</p><p>● GCP knowledge</p><p>● Kubernetes (In a production environment)</p><p>● Docker</p><p>● Knowledge of working in an Agile environment</p><p>● Infrastructure As Code</p><p>● Develop, integrate and support features in the core server stack</p><p>● Develop and support data pipeline and infrastructure</p><p><strong><u>Desirable Skills Include</u></strong><u>:</u></p><p>● Microservices Architecture</p><p>● Go</p><p>● Python</p><p>● ML Ops</p><p>● Should be able to apply different tenants' configuration through code as well as tools.</p><p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong></p><p><strong><u>● </u></strong>3-5 years of experience in working with infrastructure as code</p><p>● At least 1 year in Python or Golang</p><p>● Comfortable developing, maintaining DevOps pipelines</p><p>● Strong experience working with cloud services - AWS or GCP preferred</p><p>● Exposure to NLP/AI/ML is a huge plus</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;<strong>If interested please email me your resume at&nbsp;anna@avestacs.com</strong></p>
